author: @MrCrocker2
text: For those of you on Django 2.0 +      path('(?P<pk>(\d+))', DetailView.as_view(model=Post, template_name="blog/post.html")),  will not work. USE:       from django.urls import re_path      re_path('(?P<pk>(\d+))', DetailView.as_view(model=Post, template_name="blog/post.html")),

author: @richardsedger3959
text: In case anyone might find it useful, in Django 2 the path statement to replace the url statement for showing the blog posts is:      path('<int:pk>', DetailView.as_view(model=Post, template_name='blog/post.html')),   This does in fact say the same thing as the url statement with the regex and will only accept numbers (no SQL injection).  PS. sorry about not displaying the code as code - this is my very first comment on YouTube! (I will find out about formatting code - whether I could just have used HTML ...)

author: @SiC83
text: The anwser why 'sentdex' is are able to reference the 'P'ost contents by using 'p'ost in post.html is in django documentaion. The reference could be just 'object' but django (quote from documenation) 'when dealing with an object or queryset, Django is able to populate the context using the lower cased version of the model class’ name.' Check the "Making “friendly” template contexts' in the build-in class-based generic display views section ->  https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.10/topics/class-based-views/generic-display/#making-friendly-template-contexts

author: @MarkGardnerRuneImp
text: I was getting the error AttributeError: type object 'Post' has no attribute 'all' in Django 1.10.6 using Python 3.6.0. I fixed it by replacing "queryset=Post" with "queryset=Post.objects". Hope that helps.  :-)

author: @StormWolf01
text: That "safe" option that you can use to indicate that some DB content is safe is just a nonsense. You can never assume that the content of your own DB is safe. You need to sanitize anything that comes from your DB before displaying it. When it comes to security, you just don't trust anything. Even the things that supposedly come from you, like the content of your own blog posts.
